abstract_summ: The most common presenting symptom in patients who tested positive for COVID-19 was fever, reported in up to 83% of patients from 76.4% of the analyzed studies.The most common presenting symptom in patients who tested positive for COVID-19 was fever, reported in up to 62% of patients from 82% of the analyzed studies.The objective of this systematic review was to characterize the clinical, diagnostic, and treatment characteristics of patients presenting with COVID-19.The objective of this systematic review was to characterize the clinical, diagnostic, and treatment characteristics of hospitalized patients presenting with COVID-19.Asymptomatic patients may be contagious and thus a potential source of transmission of COVID-19.BACKGROUND To assess the overall prevalence of clinical signs, symptoms, and radiological findings in children and/or adolescents with COVID-19.
title_summ: Clinical features, Diagnosis, and Treatment of COVID-19: A systematic review of case reports and case seriesClinical and Paraclinical Characteristics of COVID-19 patients: A systematic review and meta-analysisLaboratory findings, signs and symptoms, clinical outcomes of Patients with COVID-19 Infection: an updated systematic review and meta-analysisClinical Characteristics of Coronavirus Pneumonia 2019 (COVID-19): An Updated Systematic ReviewNovel Coronavirus Infection (COVID‐19) in Children Younger Than One Year: A Systematic Review of Symptoms, Management and OutcomesClinical Features, Diagnosis, and Treatment of COVID-19 in Hospitalized Patients: A Systematic Review of Case Reports and Case SeriesAsymptomatic patients as a source of COVID-19 infections: A systematic review and meta-analysis.Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in children and/or adolescents: a meta-analysis.
title_abstract_phrases: Laboratory findings, signs and symptoms, clinical outcomes of Patients with COVID-19 Infection: an updated systematic review and meta-analysisBackground and Aim: Coronaviruses disease 2019 (COVID-19), for the first time detected in Wuhan, China, rapidly speared around the world and be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).Keywords: COVID-19; laboratory findings; prognostic factorsClinical Characteristics of Coronavirus Pneumonia 2019 (COVID-19): An Updated Systematic ReviewOBJECTIVE Clinical characteristics of novel coronavirus pneumonia (COVID-19) have been described in numerous studies but yielded varying results.METHODS Systematic searches were conducted to identify retrospective observational study that contained clinical characteristics on COVID-19 through multiple databases.The most common presenting symptom in patients who tested positive for COVID-19 was fever, reported in up to 83% of patients from 76.4% of the analyzed studies.The most common presenting symptom in patients who tested positive for COVID-19 was fever, reported in up to 62% of patients from 82% of the analyzed studies.
